name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

key_work.title: Isle of Dogs
key_work.creator_credit: Eli Bush, Jeremy Dawson, Scott Rudin, Steven M. Rales, Wes Anderson and Scott Rudin Productions
key_work.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2018

video_links.name: ISLE OF DOGS | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

key_work.brief_description: In the future, an outbreak of canine flu leads the mayor of a Japanese city to banish all dogs to an island that’s a garbage dump. The outcasts must soon embark on an epic journey when a 12-year-old boy arrives on the island to find his beloved pet.

start.title: Chicken Run
start.creator_credit: David Sproxton, Jacky Chrisp, Lenny Young, Nick Park, Peter Lord, Aardman Animations, Path√© and Phil Lewis
start.headline_credit: France, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2000
start.brief_description: Having been hopelessly repressed and facing death at the British chicken farm where they’re held, Ginger the chicken decides to rebel and lead the fellow chickens in a great escape from murderous farmers Mr. and Mrs. Tweedy.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

end.title: Mad Monster Party?
end.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin, Jr. and Jules Bass
end.brief_description: When Dr Frankenstein decides to retire from the monster-making business, he calls an international roster of monsters to a creepy convention to elect his successor.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Chicken Run was the first feature from Aardman Animations, most famous for their Wallace and Gromit shorts. Their early work was influenced by Rankin/Bass, a production company who popularised stop-motion animation in the 60s, 70s and 80s with films like Mad Monster Party.

start.title: Mad Monster Party?
start.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin, Jr. and Jules Bass
start.brief_description: When Dr Frankenstein decides to retire from the monster-making business, he calls an international roster of monsters to a creepy convention to elect his successor.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

end.title: The Frog Prince
end.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Better known for their seasonal specials, Mad Monster Party was one of Rankin/Bass’s few adult-targeted features. The technique used to animate the puppets was similar to that pioneered by German filmmaker Lotte Reiniger in her fairytale retellings like The Frog Prince.

end.title: Frankenweenie
end.brief_description: When a car hits young Victor’s pet dog Sparky, Victor brings him back to life the only way he knows how. But when the bolt-necked “monster” wreaks havoc and terror, Victor has to convince his neighbours that Sparky’s still the good, loyal friend he was.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Each dog puppet in Isle Of Dogs was required to be built in at least three different sizes ‚Äì sometimes five ‚Äì to show scale in various scenes. Kim Kong was one of the lead animators and also worked on another dog-themed animated feature, Frankenweenie.

start.title: The Princess and the Frog
start.creator_credit: Peter Del Vecho and Rob Edwards

video_links.name: The Princess and the Frog - Trailer

start.brief_description: A waitress, desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, is set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

end.title: Frozen
end.brief_description: Princess Anna dreams of finding true love at her sister Elsa‚Äôs coronation before fate takes her on a dangerous journey in an attempt to end the eternal winter that has fallen over the kingdom.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

constellations_other.name: Transfiguration
constellations_other.description: Transfiguration follows the cycle of evolution through a figure who transforms through the elements, from lava and rock to diamonds and steam. Creatures born from the elements have long been part of screen culture.

links.description: Directed and written by the duo of Ron Clements and John Musker, The Princess and the Frog marked Disney’s brief return to traditional animation before CGI films like Tangled and Frozen gained popularity.

start.title: Frankenweenie
start.brief_description: When a car hits young Victor’s pet dog Sparky, Victor brings him back to life the only way he knows how. But when the bolt-necked “monster” wreaks havoc and terror, Victor has to convince his neighbours that Sparky’s still the good, loyal friend he was.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

end.title: Chicken Run
end.creator_credit: David Sproxton, Jacky Chrisp, Lenny Young, Nick Park, Peter Lord, Aardman Animations, Path√© and Phil Lewis
end.headline_credit: France, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2000
end.brief_description: Having been hopelessly repressed and facing death at the British chicken farm where they’re held, Ginger the chicken decides to rebel and lead the fellow chickens in a great escape from murderous farmers Mr. and Mrs. Tweedy.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Kong is a world-renowned stop-motion animator and has contributed to some of the key films in the genre, including Tim Burton’s feature adaptation of his 1984 short Frankenweenie and Aardman’s beloved Chicken Run.

start.title: The Frog Prince
start.brief_description: The Frog Prince was one of several adaptations of Brothers Grimm fairytales that Lotte Reiniger made in London between 1953 and 1955.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

end.title: The Princess and the Frog
end.creator_credit: Peter Del Vecho and Rob Edwards

video_links.name: The Princess and the Frog - Trailer

end.brief_description: A waitress, desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, is set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Reiniger’s animation of characters in The Frog Prince was often a meticulous process, requiring repositioning frame-by-frame. The classic Brothers Grimm fairytale was later adapted for the big screen by Disney in 2009 with The Princess and the Frog.

end.title: Memoir of a Snail ‚Äì Pinky's puppets
end.brief_description:
Assorted Pinky Puppets:
Pinky pineapple puppet
Pinky floating in the dead sea puppet
Hippy Pinky puppet
Pinky perm puppet
Adult Pinky puppet
Testicle Pinky puppet

Pinky is an eccentric older woman who Grace meets at the local library when she‚Äôs sent to Canberra. From floating in the dead sea and bathing with snow monkeys to dancing in a schnitzel bar and outliving two husbands, Pinky has stories to tell and becomes a colourful beacon of support and hope to Grace. Pinky‚Äôs character is expressed through her wrinkled and puckered mouth. A team of artists made over a thousand plasticine mouths to make the characters talk, along with hundreds of eyeballs with magnetic pupils, which express the characters‚Äô emotions. A team of stop-motion animators spent thousands of hours moving each character one frame at a time to bring them to life.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

links.description: Like Kim Kong, renown filmmaker Adam Elliot and his team built multiple versions of the characters in Memoir of a Snail. To bring them to life over 1000 mouths were made to let the characters speak.
